Description: Black serpentine cylinder seal; contest scene- lion (head seen from above) attacking a bull which is being protected by a bearded hero who is wearing a cap decorated with a chevron design and as skirt. Lion (head seen from above) in conflict with bull-man (full-face). Human-headed bull (full-face) in conflict with a bearded hero (full-face) who is naked except for a belt. Inscription on one line, its two part separated by a double vertical line.
Bibliographic references: Guide 1922 / Guide to the Babylonian and Assyrian Antiquities in the British Museum (pp.232, 234)
Collon 1982a / Catalogue of the Western Asiatic Seals in the British Museum: Cylinder Seals II: Akkadian, Post Akkadian, Ur III Periods (14, pl.III)
Leichty E et al 1988a / Catalogue of the Babylonian Tablets in the British Museum, volume VIII: Tablets from Sippar 3 (p.300)
Boehmer R M 1965a / Die Entwicklung der Glyptik wahrend der Akkad-Zeit
Acquisition name: From: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
